title: Season 7 is the season of stupid supports
body: So this season is probably the most I have ever seen off-meta supports, ever. I either lose because my team has a stupid off-meta, or the enemy team has an off-meta and my team doesn't know how to fight it. I play mid and top and I leave my winning lane to help and all the sudden I'm super negative, and all my LP is gone in a day. Example, I went {{champion:202}} Jhin adc is ranked and I had this wonderful support: {{champion:101}} . He fed 13 kills in 10 minutes. Then I play {{champion:91}} Talon mid. And the enemy support? {{champion:103}} . I was 5/0 in under 10 minutes and had half my build completed when I notice the enemy {{champion:96}} kog'maw is 10/0. This season is so stupid.

I stayed optimistic and tried playing Taric through the first half of the season. As his win rate drops, I'm just giving up. Fighting AP carries bottom is just miserable as a melee support tank. Riot said they would make changes if they got forced out and nothing has been done about it. 

My main is a support melee champ with a solo laner's power curve. So I'm useless against AP early, mediocre mid game and useless against BC and LW late game.

I'm saddled with generic support items that anyone can take and doesn't make my kit anymore effective than my opponent.

Being a support main feels super bad when taking my champion Top is the only way I can be effective.

I reached Gold with him so far and I just can't enjoy going bot with him at the moment.

Why not just buff all melee supports to where they can out-duel any AP "support" even w/o proper itemization? See, that's the solution to this stupid, "Everything can be a support, as long as it can deal magic damage and has CC" meta.

If this was a rage post, then fine. If it's attempting to present a real argument I have a few objections:

1. Don't conflate off-meta and feeding. Correlation is not causation. 

2. I get your frustration. I play support often and having a dope down there with you is absolute hell. But the S7 changes to support (e.g. getting carry mages) is a good evolution for the game. Are there growing pains? Yes. But once we move beyond them it will be a net-gain. 

3. People asking for traditional supports are equivalent to asking for traditional gender roles. You don't actually care, you just don't want anyone muscling in on your territory. But I find this to be a very self-centered view of the game. And frankly, in a game that favors adaptability, if the support happened to get some kills, adapt. Or push yourself harder. Don't ask for your support to suck more. 

4. The anecdotal evidence you're citing isn't something we can operate on. But what I'd say to you us (and I do this) if the support is the role you find weakest, play it and run the table on people. Because if the weakest link in stronger than their weakest link, you should be winning.

I hovered Trundle support earlier today.
**Team:** *"WTF, pick a support."*
(>_>)

Enemy team picks Draven/Morgana, ADC picks Twitch. I know Draven out-trades Twitch early game and Morg invalidates Trundle, so I switch to Yorik.
**Team:** *"WTF, Yorik is useless."*
(>_>)

Lane phase, Twitch keeps forcing wave under enemy turret, Eating Draven's AA's, and dropping jungler bait. By the glory of a 20 second CD Jarvin ult (That Black shield *can't* ignore), I manage to keep him alive for the first ~8 minutes. Then he dies.
**Team:** *"You can't even peel."*
(>_>)

I spend mid game throwing monsters wave bot with my ~~Free Banner of Command~~ Ult. Manage to Drop almost 2 turrets (Equivalent), in addition to picks and peels with the Jarvin ult. Enemy Draven AFK's effectively ending the game.
**Enemy team:** *"Lucky 4v5"*
**Ally team:** *"4v4. Yorik didn't do anything."*
( O ____ O )


I fully concede, I do a lot of strange/stupid crap. But that's not an excuse to put blinders on.
I don't just pull these things out of the Sheep's handbook. I know what I'm doing ~~most of the time~~.
(T_T)
